GZ5lnwoKlTNDG-vZsGOYwg.text: This place has lobsters ... and burger, but I wouldnt know since I got the lobster roll and my wife got the steamed lobster. This place reminds me of Flat Iron with its simple menu and sides. The lobsters were not bad. Decent size for £20 a lobster. So why 3 stars? I come from the city of Los Angeles and having lived next to the beach my whole life, I have had plenty of tasty lobsters for a more reasonable price. I understand its London and while the main dishes were good, unfortunately it wasnt good enough to stand out in my mind. Or at least compare to the lobsters I have had.I would probably recommend just getting the whole lobster, compare to the roll (the roll is only served cold by the way). I wouldnt mind going back again if I dont know what I should eat when Im back, however it wouldnt be my top go to place. The service was average and ok. For those that doesnt get lobsters often, give them a try, its not bad at all. For the seafood fanatics, there are probably better choices out there. Overall a decent establishment that I would recommend.

AoMvTUa0iljV6vWMqCSmdg.text: Without fresh lobsters, any lobster dish will never turn out good.But it was never the case for this outlet! The lobsters were fresh and delicious! There are basically 3 mains on the menu.We got the whole lobster and the lobster wrap.I will definitely recommend the whole lobster for those looking to have a generous portion of succulent meat for just 20pounds.They have it in garlic or steam. Definitely go for the steam if you are not a garlic fan as the garlic taste might be overbearing.Alternatively, the wrap offers a easier dining option as the meat are mixed with fragrant garnish and placed into a bun which is DELICIOUS.Every meal comes with a side of salad and fries so you will definitely leave full.They do charge for water though.The staff are amazing friendly and helpful.

pJZTNOyr-xHnIgYVEi3YuA.text: The first B&L I tried was their Soho location, and it was absolutely phenomenal. My second experience here was a bit more disappointing. They didn't bring the butter/garlic sauce for all our lobster rolls and we were really confused as to what was missing. I had already eaten 3/4 of my roll when my boyfriend figured we were missing that sauce... what a shame! And the lobster was too cold! Everyone who's reading this make sure to get that sauce.

EUJLVLZoIylOFdnLC8MYEg.text: We found this place though the good yelp reviews when we were in London. Relatively the food was ok but the customer service was very surprisingly-BAD!  We went in at around 2pm which was after the busy lunch hours. There were not too many people so we did not even need to wait for the seats. After we sit down, we asked for water and shortly we ordered our food. our waiter basically disappeared after our order..( he was just standing there and chatted with others). We tried to do eye contact with him but he seems just ignore us. After couple times attempt, I couldn't take it and had to ask another waiter next to me to get us the water! We got our water after we almost finished our food! our waiter basically just showed up with our bill at the end of our meal.  We paid $$ for our lobster meal and also be charged for the water. I did not expect this kind of service honestly with this charge. Husband and I agreed that we would not go back to this place.

WK_LP7svTA7QYf2R1iUmbQ.text: love the place. love the food. the atmosphere is great and cheerful which makes great dining experience. the menu is always simple and awesome, both food and drinks. very london.

-Qxr6Lo8xq6DHwgbGCbizg.text: I have been meaning to come here for so long. I almost forgot it was on my list of restaurants to check out. So one Friday last minute me and a friend managed to catch up and we chose Burger and Lobster as we both wanted to check it out. I looked at the reviews of a few branches of this chain restaurant and this one had the least waiting time as well as being extremely central. We both ordered for Lobster Roll with chips and salad. The Lobster Roll is gorgeous, this is the second Lobster Roll I have had, the first being at Bob's Lobster which was amazing. The roll was brioche, slightly toasted and absolutely gorgeous. The Lobster meat was lovely, it is mixed with Japanese mayonnaise. The chips were crispy and fluffy, just right and exactly the way I like it. We also had garlic butter which was flavoursome, not too creamy or garlic which worked quite well. The salad was as tasty as salad can be. I ordered a hot drink which was just perfect for the cold weather outside, unfortunately I don't remember the name. I would definitely come back here for the Lobster Roll. If I feel adventurous enough, I might try the Lobster.

3yY1FN6RNQt2UTBRKoQ3rg.text: Great chain and good value for what you get. Would recommend just getting the lobster as the burger isn't worth £20 as can find much better - and cheaper - burgers elsewhere in London, nor is the lobster roll (albeit good). Once you're seated service is quick and can be in and out in less than 30 minutes. Overall great spot.

ajRqttcqSdOxOfQpPz1K0A.text: If you're going to go here, you should get the lobster.  Paying 20 for burger is kind of a shame.  The lobster is pretty good, but I would definitely skip on the sauce as it's far too heavy and you lose the flavor of the lobster

7sUwc_D6ImUpbhCE9mTpVg.text: Complete rip-off. Went to the Oxford circus branch and you do not get the burger and lobster deal for £20. You either get a lobster for £20 OR a burger for £20, both will cost you £40.

9vwG0R_mfPUsun1LDPYfWQ.text: Unfortunately i didn't really rate this place! The lobster seemed fresh. And the staff were friendly but it was slightly over priced and my group of friends had to share a communal table with another family, not ideal!

fSJNH1bkVf6lXPLWjzwRpw.text: This place is a godsend. I came here for lunch on a Sunday at 12pm and the place was empty. No need for queueing!I'm pretty sure everyone knows the menu by now, but here goes...You pick either beef burger/lobster roll/grilled lobster/steamed lobster with free flow fries and salad for 20 quid.I got the grilled lobster and a friend got the lobster roll. I got a lobster, and more than I bargained for. Apparently my lobster was smaller than usual so they gave me an extra half lobster. I was beyond happy. The lobster comes with either butter or lemon garlic sauce. I felt that the lemon garlic sauce didn't quite complement the lobster and slightly overwhelmed it... But please try the fries with this sauce. Out of this world!Their fries are decent but I didn't like their salad - spinach with some nuts and caramelized onions with a balsamic-ish dressing. Would I come back? Hell yes and with a bib!

b0oC3p-XbZ-xwR4QO6nMxQ.text: Decor is fabulous, food was very good.  We had the broiled lobster and it was wonderful.   The butter sauce was absolutely delicious.   They serve skinny chips (fries to Americans) and the salad had a very tasty dressing on top.  I highly recommend this!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

qHjefzMImrt9uCvLI4RSqw.text: When this place opened it was like a lobster revolution! Since then, it's expanded and is going strong. Good place for casual dinner but I wouldn't say it's anything special. Go for the lobster, not for the burger.

SkpVhyDYZ_ciUCWBOdZRxg.text: Me and my partner came here after some shopping around 2:45pm and was informed that they will be closing at 3pm so some strange reason, however the staff still welcomed us in. Its a experience worth going to. It was slightly confusing how the menu was presented since it was not directly in front of you in a physical form, however the options were burgers, lobster - either steamed or grilled, or lobster roll. I chosen the grilled lobster but if i knew the option of lobster roll was available at the time of ordering, I would've chosen that.It is a noisy place and reasonable size place considering the location, definitely worth going.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The grilled lobster option and the burger option. The blood orange juice was a tad on the sour side

DMah4rt6juYdieXzh9GpHw.text: Tucked away in a side street near Oxford circus is the 6th branch of burger and lobster.  We were tempted to pay a visit during the opening weeks by the offer of a free cocktail and besides we needed to eat!I arrived around 6pm to a virtually empty restaurant, by 7pm the place was full.  So if you do not want to join the unpredictable waiting list for a table get there early for dinner.  The format is the same as the other branches there is no food menu, there are 3 choices all served with the same 2 sides of fries and green salad for a fixed price of £201) Steamed or grilled lobster2) lobster roll3) BurgerHaving previously tried the unhealthy but quite tasty lobster roll on my last visit to a B&L, I returned to my usual of steamed lobster with garlic butter.  This was served piping hot, the lobster meat was moist and crunchy.Service was very friendly and attentive.  The server recommended cocktails based on our taste preference and checked that we were happy with the cocktails.  As I like sweet cocktails I selected the 'dean street breeze' a mixture of beefeater gin, mango, cucumber and soda - this was a sweet and refreshing choice.The new Fitzrovia branch of B&L is one of the better branches, the lobster was cooked perfectly on this visit.  It is less busy than soho and has bigger capacity than Mayfair so you are more likely to get a table quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Cocktail menu
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Giant lobster
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster tanks

_AoPQFJrbqRMqx7VvQGZYQ.text: I get that London is trying to make lobster affordable to the masses but this place is like the TGI Fridays of our age.I've been to the Dean Street branch but this one is not even as nice as that. The decor could double as a Pizza Hut. We didn't even get our own table. We were a table of 6 stuck in the middle of a huge communal table in a crowded restaurant sharing next to a grumpy looking family. And you want me to pay £8.50 for a cocktail? How about no?! The fact that Burger and Lobster has become nothing more than a production line should be no more evident than the fact that the food comes out in less than five minutes. The food was fine. It is what it is. And yes there are three options so they don't have to make it from scratch, but it feels like a child's birthday party. If you do want to treat yourself to lobster, then go to any other nice decent place. They don't have a monopoly on lobster! Spend your money on somewhere you'll feel like an actual guest in the restaurant not another number through the door. Can you imagine even ordering dessert here? It's like getting a McFlurry after your no. 2 burger with fries.

J7eS7gIwfe0cWOBPAScoaA.text: Yum. Yum. Yum. Went at lunch time with my work mates and I shared a lobster and a lobster roll. Both were outstanding. My other work mate ordered the burger but after trying the lobster, she regretted it and it wished she too had ordered the lobster. You get fries and a salad with it too. It's so filling that I didn't even eat dinner! You can't go wrong with a £20 lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster feast

-yPDQQuYakDduSCHf9vrZg.text: Horribly overpriced tourist hole with £16 burgers, no kids menu and mass-produced and hollow faux fun ambience and surly staff trying to upsell. Much better places in soho that have genuine flare

8KVHH3J2ZNbCy3w9fKxypg.text: Weird and unique concept that only London or another big city can sustain. So the restaurant offers just three menu option!  That's right, only three and nothing else. There is a hamburger variation with toppings, a lobster, and a lobster sandwich. That's it!  All served with the same side. To my surprise, the place was packed. We arrived around 6 PM on a week night and already we had to wait 20 mins. By the time we left, the line appeared to be much longer. My son had a hamburger and I had a lobster roll. My sandwich had huge chunks of lobster but would have been better warm, just my humble opinion.  Fries was good, not too greasy or salty, just right. As with many London restaurants, service was slow and at most mediocre, but I'm comparing to US. Atmosphere was very happy, full of young professionals, everyone looked really happy. All in all, good but not amazing.

F6j6U-xCn-yyFfLPeZapIA.text: Birthday celebration !My friend recommended that I should try this place, it was by default I had chosen to come here with my guest, because the other restaurant wasn't helpful but I was very happy I went here instead.We ordered from the waiter who told us what is only served @ burger & lobster.So the offer we went with was two sharing a lobster, having your own burger, fries, salad and desert for £60.Trust me it was well worth it, the amount of food to eat was a lot but it was really tasty.Me and guest will be going back very soon.Staff was friendly and wasn't rushing you to leave.Cocktail was really good a reasonable priceFriends and staff surprise me with my birthday cake and wishes,a really good meal shared with loved ones!Great night.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Loads of food made with love
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Burger & Lobster

0_O4F0O_cKEmt03M7QbhDg.text: We were brought to our table which still had Lobster shell piece on the chair. Table was sticky. I am not sure if the cleaning after each customer is done thoroughly. I ordered a classic burger medium since the waiter asked how I like it. When the burger came I cut it in half and there was nothing near pink visible. Well done was more like it. I won't return.16£ for a burger is ridiculous especially when it is not cooked as ordered.

LWGcxo2cAezBWtRyNaJJkg.text: My girlfriend and I loved this place. We went to the location in London. Not too sure if it is a chain or not but oh well! The lobster and burger combo was very appetizing. It is a reasonable price for lobster in my opinion. The burger was very good as well. It was a good restaurant and I would recommend it to a friend. I gave it five stars instead of four because of the service. The manager was extremely friendly and sat down and spoke with my girlfriend and I for quite sometime.

qZy9kf0h4NnBk3jZLgxy7A.text: Only the second branch of this small chain of restaurants I've been to. Having normally gone to the Soho branch, when my friends suggested we head here at 9:30 pm on a Friday night, I thought 'Fat chance of getting in here' especially for a party of 8.But no, the very pretty hostess asked if we'd be happy splitting our group and said she'd be able to do something in about half an hour. Retreating to The Social next door, we had a drink and were called half an hour later. Returning, we were greeted with a smile and seated at two tables. Beers and lobster were ordered and went down a treat, they came very quickly though, quickly enough that I thought they were already prepared, but they weren't overcooked at all. We shared a couple of desserts, but what they described as a cheesecake was honestly more like a parfait, it wasn't set at all. Taking off one point for the dessert (I love making cheesecake, so don't call it one if it so obviously isn't!), it gives a four star awesome review. Honestly I was full and didn't need the dessert so ordinarily wouldn't have noticed but unfortunately I did!

PNRZK2MkbNj__S-MRUfdQA.text: Lovely salad and dressing was perfect. Lobster roll was so good!!  And friendly helpful service!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Awesome friendly service!

Zi8n_ws5xkx6PdXuJ9tJmA.text: Great lunch.   Causal and friendly environment.  Reasonably priced lobster roll for the size and how fresh it was.  I'll be back for a quick delicious lunch again.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll, chips and salad.

qMaJoLQz3TrqqPEkB5qGZA.text: Somewhat overly praised, Burger and Lobster is simply a place to have (guess what?) burger and lobster. Yes the lobsters are fresh as the turnover on them is so quick and this branch actually has several tanks for all different sizes of them. However, I find the lobster has little flavour, the garlic and butter sauce it comes with is flavoursome but too salty and the fries are also noticeably more salty than necessary. Nevertheless this branch of Burger and Lobster seems marginally better than the one in Soho in all respects. In comparison with Soho, the service here is good with very little waiting time for a table and prompt arrival of food and drink upon ordering. On previous visits to Burger and Lobster I have tried the burger which was unremarkable and salty and alongside the salty fries can leave you very thirsty; I have tried the portion of lobster for one person twice and to anyone who likes eating lobster it is worth trying out for novelty value but for someone like me who is accustomed to having lobster it can seem rather unextraordinary; in contrary, I do recommend their lobster roll which is a unique and delightful combination of melt-in-the-mouth brioche with a lobster and mayonnaise filling giving it a pleasant but not too strong taste. The portion of lobster roll does appear quite small for a main course and may not fill you up on a hungry day but the side salad and chips that come with every meal help. The burger and lobster apron, open kitchen, interesting cocktails and restaurant setting all succeed in creating a nice experience but not quite exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll with side salad and chips
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

rcZ0S8P84AWyuvOysyIEbw.text: When my friend said she was hosting her birthday dinner here I was super pleased. After only tasting lobster for the first time earlier this year, it's fair enough to say I am fully obsessed with it now. So you pay £20 and get 3 choices, burger, lobster or lobster roll - not too sure why you'd choose the burger!! I obviously chose the lobster which was really good. It came with a salad, fries and gorgeous butter sauce. The lobster was cooked to perfection.The staff were very helpful and friendly. I'd brought a cake for my friend and they were more than happy to look after it then bring it up after we'd finished our dinner.

JYTGSPuOe9PUuVXRJIzv6w.text: I can not remember the times I have been to Burger & Lobster. But it has always been the Soho branch. So I was exciting to visit their new branch near Oxford Circus tube station. The restaurant is really hidden on Little Portland Street and you would not have expected to find a restaurant there.The restaurant is not as big as their Soho branch but have two massive long table for a feast. We booked a table at 6pm and it was not very busy when we arrived. But when we left around 8pm there was a crowd of people at the entrance.Having been there many times I already knew what I wanted which is lobster! I shared with a friend a lobster roll, and grilled lobster. We had half each! The way to satisfied my tastebuds!I washed this all down with the BL iced tea which had watermelon. It was a really refreshing drink and they even have a alcohol version.The food was just as good as the Soho branch and still it is the best place for lobster in London that is worth the price!

QGmbhqeqdCtc35RP93QBug.text: I have been waiting for a good time to come here and finally treated to dinner by some vendors and I love the food. Nothing better than this! Don't eat much of burgers but this was too juicy to miss and the lobster was too good that it wasn't enough! Good value for money (well, I'm not really paying here) . I would love to come back. Service is too notch too (the waiter had a tequila shot with a colleague!)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Burger/lobster. If you want a mix , share the opposite mean with someone !

mP2tNeVnSzWPT-E7p6nfrw.text: Food is great,staff are kind, ambient is really pleasant.  But price are high for 3 of us we paid 120 pounds which is like we had a dinner in Novikov.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

7kaikCy-LACLQMBKFzRLbw.text: I judge burgers harshly. Lobster not so much because I'm not sure how to grade it.You'll notice it is located on a narrow street that looks like an alley. Almost like a hole in the wall type of place.The bar had a great selection for both men and women who chose the classics. The thing i like most was the service. They were nice and very attentive. I see why a local would become a regular here. The prices are amazing-ly cheap for London.For those in america, i could rate the burger like a better version of super duper burger. It was juicy and the size made you want another. The lobster was tasty. Usually i have to add many add ons to make it good for me. It is located in a very busy part of London, so if you walk from the train station be prepared to battle crowds. Its recommended

8JmQuFcWTh-WMRLnon5Mww.text: Tasty American burger. HUGE. Good service and decent beer. All around great. I got the original burger with bacon and cheese and it was cooked perfectly medium. Was MUCH bigger than I expected. Red Claw beer hit the spot with my burger. Awesome ambiance too, casual and cool.

jt5f3AHJfVcuIBo4uHtdbg.text: Not sure if I should be dancing or eating.Mariah Busta Rhymes and even Diana Ross belting out some good jams.  I sat st the bar ( which is Kind high, I sat on my purse)  and enjoyed a great host there. My food came out hot and fresh and the drinks were made beautifully. I had the fried prawn appetizer which came with a delicious spicy tomato salsa the sauce as well as a spicy mayo version. I'll get it again when I come back. Then my lobster roll was really good too. I'm the kind that eats the filling out with a fork, the bread just gets in the way. Glad I did. So yummy. Can't wait to return.Dances out stage left....

CuRWJ7dxH4l2PJSNFnT0BA.text: We ordered the beef & lobster burger and lobster roll, the roll is good (4 out of 5) and the burger is better, the mix of beef and seafood is juicy and refreshing

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

dAoz1sEyuIzhr-mBqbq03w.text: I love Burger and Lobster. Being a lobster snob, my favourite activity is to get the "big boys" lobsters on the grill. If you want to experience DA BOMB, forget about the 3 lobster, lobster rolls, or burger option and try out the Big Boys. OMG! You will not regret. Not only do you get unlimited slides, the best lobster is definitely anything over 3+ pounds. Burger & Lobster consistently have fresh uber big boys made to order. Definitely Yum Yum YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. 4.5 kg lobster
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

KX1WAaMgGEF7C2LjFcYWLQ.text: Good value/quality ratio.   Service was fast and friendly.  We had a nice business lunch.

arcsdwJYpzTPPgrUDMU_Dw.text: On the last cold and rainy day of the year in London, hubby and I found ourselves amidst Oxford street with lots of shopping bags and rumbling stomachs. A quick search on Yelp lured us to Burger and Lobster, which was a fun experience. The menu has either, yup you guessed it, burgers or lobster on it. You could also get a plate with both to try the two. Hubby being a lobster fan, directly went for the lobster plate, and I, having an aversion to lobster went for the cheeseburger. We also ordered olives and nuts, alongside a huge fishbowl of some delicious rum-filled drink to share. The olives and nuts came out quickly and they were well portioned - very generous actually. The fishbowl came next and was good but not great. You could taste the liquor but, as is normal with these types of drinks, the drink was kind of watered down. Following some sips, our main dishes came out. Like before, the portions were really big, and food was pretty delicious. It had been my first burger in months so that might be why I thought it was so good but that's besides the point. Hubby thoroughly enjoyed his lobster, any we could both barely finish our plates because they were so large. Overall, a great experience minus the hefty price tag (but then again, everything in London is unnecessarily expensive).

LPHqCA5Ci06_LTLy2qmLjg.text: A must if you are in the area, we stumbled upon it on our way to get passport pictures and glad we made a stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

MGKJ6_noWKqQ4WZclUhb2w.text: We came here for dinner about 6pm, we had booked a table in advance which wasn't necessary. The place was half full and we were seated straight away. Service was fast and friendly. I had the 10oz burger, daughter had the grilled lobster and hubby had the combo. Food was very lovely and fresh. The drinks were great too. A bit pricey but well worth it we thought.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

mlsvF-uAUtqyU-Yy8gzfGw.text: Ordered the lobster & had a second! Definitely love the lobster. Waitstaff was super friendly & chill. Burger was also good although the entire party loved the lobster more. Also liked the croquette, which was recommended by the Waitstaff. Price was also reasonable for the quality of food. Would recommend it to others.

wa1A_e50cJtPJgVnMNWWrw.text: The menu has changed! It is no longer 3 options at £20 each.....they have updated it now so there are multiple choices with varying prices.The burgers have reduced in price - which they should have done ages ago as all foodies know that you can get the exact same burger from Goodman at a cheaper price....The standard lobster, i believe is now £26. Quite a steep increase.  Still tasty, but i might not go back as often as i used to as i can go to many other restaurants to try different foods at that price.  My friend and i had a cocktail each and a mint green tea. the total cost came up to £43 each.

9egm9srWYYSvAZtmgkehvA.text: I thought that the concept for this place is pretty good. And I didn't think that £20 was too bad for half a lobster, garlic butter sauce, chips and salad. I'd never actually eaten lobster before and neither had my dinner companions so we were all excited to try. I thought that it was very good however I soon discovered that my favourite part of the meal was the salad.  I guess I prefer lobster cooked differently, not on its own. The service was very good, we were served pretty quickly and left pretty quickly however they took ages to seat us even though we booked the table beforehand. And I also told them that it was my sister's birthday and normally, some restaurants do a little dessert or a drink and this is the first time that I have been to a restaurant and they have done nothing. Needless to say, I wasn't impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The grilled lobster with chips, salad and a garlic butter sauce.

vRyxn5D-qmHMHMY-DxxZww.text: Sorry to disappoint everyone, but I didn't see what the hype was about. Don't get me wrong, there are a lot of things to love about this upmarket chain. If you love love LOVE lobster, this place is a must try. The only reason I'm giving this a 3 instead of a usual 4 is that I got a violent upset tummy shortly after leaving the restaurant and I question how sanitary the servers are. So let me break it down:Food: The food tasted as good as it looked: steamed lobster with herb and lemon butter all the way. They only serve three main items: burger, lobster (steamed or grilled), and lobster roll. Albeit, a simple menu, I just find it weird there isn't a menu for me to hold or look at when I sit down. This caused further confusion, because my friend misheard the desserts and ordered something completely different to what she thought it was. They were nice enough to take it off the cheque though.Service: The servers were really understanding and patient with us. One thing my friend pointed out was that the servers (at this branch anyway) were a bit too friendly with each other, and we saw them slapping each other butts. I thought nothing of it, but to people who are germ-a-phoebes, like the friends I was with, did not find it amusing. After all, they do touch people's food in between joking around and slapping each others bums. Perhaps that was the reason why I got sickOverall, I don't think I'll be coming back on my own volition; but if someone really wanted to go, I wouldn't mind tagging along.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. A bib for all your messes.
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Their life is in your hands!
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The steamed lobster

UP4bHte8JNYki4ox4yNUUw.text: Best burger I've ever had ever! And ate it together with lobster?? It was heaven in my mouth.. and my tummy!!

XWQueKBi8dawfHpDFD28nA.text: If there was one reliable, moorish, consistent, drool worthy, simple, tasty, cannot go wrong that it'll make you go weak at the knees when it arrives at your table meal.... then it's at Flat Iron's older brother.Lobster Roll went down the pipe faster than Usain Bolt running the 100m. Smashed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

rn0Ze_qJiS9oHP4GinzDtw.text: This place is so good!!I've been wanting to try Burger and Lobster for a while now after hearing really good things about it. My husband and I were shopping late at Oxford Circus and realized that this branch was nearby, so we wandered on over. We were seated right away and ordered a cocktail and a beer before deciding on what to eat.This place doesn't have a menu but serves just three dishes; the lobster roll, whole lobster or a burger. All at £20 a dish, served with a salad and fries.  We ordered one grilled lobster and one steamed lobster, getting both the regular butter and garlic and lemon sauce. The lobster was a really good size (I think 1.5lb) and tasted amazing. The steamed lobster was more juicy than the grilled, so I'd order that one next time. For dessert we had the chocolate and vanilla ice cream and an espresso. The ice cream was surprisingly delicious! It had a biscuit layer on the bottom, with chocolate and vanilla soft serve ice cream, topped with brownie pieces and caramel. Yum! The espresso had a really nice intensity too and exceeded my expectations.Overall I thought it was fantastic value and a delicious treat- my only criticism would be that they seemed a bit short on servers. I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Delicious chocolate and vanilla soft serve...
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Grilled Lobster!

fX32D-1c17JatqYpaD5Ncg.text: You can choose your lobster too be grilled or streamed. Choice of butter with herbs or without. I highly recommend the earl grey tea with watermelon and lemon.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Pounder

l1i3tZsf5BnCbCZaMjEIXQ.text: Lobster steamed has sweet natural taste, grilled is fragrant with accompanying cheese sauce. Lovely salad included. Chips soggy, old, unimpressive. Good thing this chain doesn't advertise on chips, just focus on lobster!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

jfH6mMs8VDcAfeAYhkM9zQ.text: Generous portion including salad, a roll and chips. Lobster chunks fully filled the bun which taste good! I love how buttery the brioche bun is completed with the butter sauce which nails the dish. Good value. But for a cheaper option you can visit smack lobster

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

Gt6qbLK_75taNTRzcbSxwg.text: Here's all you need to know: I was in London for two nights. I ate here both nights.(Strictly speaking, that's not exactly true. The first night, I ate at the Burger & Lobster in Mayfair. But you get the idea.)After enjoying a lobster roll my first night in London, I fully intended to eat dinner somewhere else the next day. But after a late night of shopping, I found myself at Oxford Circus at 9pm with an empty stomach. I checked for nearby restaurants, and lo and behold, another Burger & Lobster was just a few short blocks away!The Little Portland Street location was much, MUCH less crowded than the Mayfair location had been the night before. I walked in and sat at the bar, ready to order at once. Then I realized why I was the only one sitting at the bar. While seated in the barstools, the bar itself practically reached my shoulders! Clearly there was no way I could competently eat a lobster raising my arms that high so I requested a table instead and was swiftly seated. That hiccup aside, the rest of my dinner was absolutely fantastic. I ordered the grilled lobster and it was just amazing. Of course the fries and the salad were terrific, but I already knew that from my experience in the Mayfair location. I had never eaten grilled lobster before and did not realize what a treat I was in for. I think it was probably the best £20 I've ever spent on food. As I was leaving, I noticed a sign proclaiming the imminent opening of Burger & Lobster's NYC location. As that's a bit closer to home for me, I absolutely can't wait!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Coming soon to New York??!! Meet you there, Burgers & Lobster!!
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Really enjoyed the 1936 beer.
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Grilled lobster, fries, salad. I highly recommend the grilled lobster!!
